title: No run game in Kansas City? Poor O-lines in Houston, Minnesota? Real-or-not ratings for every team
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

title: What we're hearing: Latest on Aaron Rodgers, Bengals' plans without Joe Burrow
content: Our insiders have intel on Rodgers' first two games in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati's post-Burrow scramble and more.

title: Jets rule out Fields vs. Bucs, to start Taylor at QB
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields remains in concussion protocol and will not play Sunday against the Buccaneers.

title: Source: Injury to Bolts' Mack not season-ending
content: Khalil Mack's left elbow injury, which left him sidelined and in a sling for much of the Chargers' Week 2 victory over the Raiders, isn't season-ending, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Banged-up Commanders reunite with LB Smith
content: The Commanders signed veteran pass rusher Preston Smith, bolstering a defensive line that just lost one of its starters.

title: Top Packers WR Reed has clavicle, foot surgeries
content: Packers wide receiver Jayden Reed underwent surgery Tuesday on a broken clavicle and a Jones fracture in his left foot.

title: Aggies' Anderson avoided 'catastrophic injury'
content: Texas A&M safety Bryce Anderson avoided "catastrophic injury" after being taken to a hospital for testing following a serious collision against Notre Dame.

title: Americans Moon, Morris finish 1-2 in pole vault
content: American pole vaulter Katie Moon captured her third consecutive world title Wednesday by edging Sandi Morris on her final attempt to capture gold.

title: Townsend apologizes for criticizing Chinese food
content: American tennis star Taylor Townsend has apologized "from the bottom of my heart" for making disparaging comments about Chinese food on social media.

title: Liberty's Stewart to put knee to test in Game 2
content: New York Liberty star Breanna Stewart said she plans to play Wednesday night in Game 2 of the Liberty's first-round WNBA playoff series against the Phoenix Mercury after injuring her knee during Game 1 on Sunday.

title: 📉 CFB Bottom 10: Cold teams, hot coaches' seats
content: The head coaches at UCLA and Virginia Tech already are toast -- and the temperature is rising for others.

content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: What MLB aces look like in 2025 compared to past decades
content: Paul Skenes and Tarik Skubal are having great seasons within the context of modern baseball. But how do they compare to aces of the past? Let's find out.

content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

content: Not all upsets are created equal, but when upsets like NIU-Notre Dame or others happen, they have some common traits.

content: Bowling Green may have a former Heisman Trophy winner for a coach, but the biggest star on this team is a cat.

content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Crawford takes top spot; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford delivered an impressive performance and moved up, but what about Canelo Alvarez? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: Cardi B announces she, Stefon Diggs are expecting a child
content: The Patriots wide receiver and Grammy Award-winning rapper have been spotted in public with each other since February.

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

content: Matchups are the key to fantasy lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable for Week 3 at QB, RB, WR and TE.

content: Eric Karabell updates his rankings at every position for the rest of the season, including his top 100 overall.

title: Arsenal show at Athletic that they possess the depth to win UCL
content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

title: Champions League recap: 10-man Madrid defeat Marseille, Juve draw with Dortmund
content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

content: Less than 25% of the NWSL regular season is left, and the race to be crowned the league's MVP is heating up.

title: Who are the breakout U21 Champions League players you don't know?
content: With a host of young players in the Champions League squads, we look at the next breakout stars under the age of 21 this season.

title: Is Mbappé the quickest Real Madrid player to 50 goals? Not even close
content: Kylian Mbappé is the fastest player to reach a half-century of goals for Real Madrid since Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Kobbie Mainoo wanted by Newcastle
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is a January target for Newcastle United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Breakout rankings: Defensemen predicted for breakout success this season
content: Prepare for your fantasy hockey draft with these defensemen in the right situation to have a break out season.

title: Patani house firing case: Two accused killed in encounter; joint op by Delhi Police, UP STF
content: In a recent development, the two accused individuals, Ravinda alias Kullu and Arun, involved in the firing incident outside actor Disha Patani's father's residence, have died from injuries sustained during an encounter with Uttar Pradesh's Special Task Force. The incident occurred in Ghaziabad, and the accused were identified as members of the Goldy Brar and Rohit Godara gang.

title: 'Hydrogen bomb' incoming? Rahul to hold special presser tomorrow ; 'vote chori' row set to intensify
content: Rahul Gandhi is set to hold a press briefing following his allegations of voter theft, promising a significant expose against the BJP. He previously accused the Election Commission of colluding with the BJP to manipulate elections, citing irregularities in Bengaluru Central's electoral rolls.

title: Microsoft's ultimatum: Return to office; 3 days or consequences
content: Microsoft is mandating employees to return to the office for at least three days a week, starting February 2026, or risk career limitations. The policy, beginning with Seattle-area staff, emphasizes in-person collaboration for advancement, particularly in AI development. Non-compliance could impact performance reviews and access to key projects, signaling a shift from remote work flexibility.

title: Drama! PCB labels Andy Pycroft 'controversial', says he apologised to Pakistan captain
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) issued a statement that ICC match referee Andy Pycroft apologized for the "no-handshake" incident during the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, saying that it happened due to miscommunication. Earlier, the PCB formally requested Pycroft's replacement for their subsequent match, a request that was denied. Pycroft is the match referee for the game, leaving Pakistan in an embarrassing spot.

title: ‘Will be addressed satisfactorily’: Goyal optimistic on India-US deal; calls relations positive
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed confidence in resolving trade issues with the US, citing the strong friendship between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump. Recent talks between Indian and US trade negotiators have been positive, aiming for a mutually beneficial agreement.

title: Bihar: Darbhanga court rejects bail of man who abused PM Modi's mother
content: A Darbhanga court rejected the bail plea of Mohammad Rizvi, accused of using abusive language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his mother. Rizvi allegedly made the remarks on August 27 from a Congress platform during Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra'. The court denied bail based on Rizvi's confession to the investigating officer.

title: Amazon CEO’s warning: Company’s culture may be at risk; needs a reset
content: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: Putin dials Modi: PM thanks 'friend'; 'India ready to help in Ukraine conflict'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday, received warm greetings from Russian President Vladimir Putin. Modi thanked Putin, reaffirming India's commitment to strengthening their strategic partnership. He also expressed India's readiness to contribute to a peaceful resolution of the Ukraine conflict.

title: 'Tarnished son's reputation': Father of AI 171 pilot slams AAIB; seeks 'formal' probe
content: The father of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who perished in the Air India Ahmedabad crash that killed 260, is demanding a formal government inquiry, expressing distress over alleged leaks suggesting his son was suicidal. He refutes claims about his son's mental state, citing his extensive flying experience and lack of prior incidents.

title: ‘I’m disappointed with…’: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang after China sends ‘loud and clear’ message to tech companies on banning AI chips
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to cease purchasing Nvidia's AI chips, including the RTX Pro 6000D. This ban extends beyond previous restrictions, signaling a commitment to developing domestic AI systems. Huang acknowledged the fluctuating nature of Nvidia's China business due to ongoing US-China discussions.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Culture-war opportunism; attack on US higher ed
content: The killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has ignited a fierce debate that places American universities in the dock. While the accused had only brief ties to higher education, attention has shifted to faculty remarks, with over a dozen educators disciplined for mocking Kirk’s death. Coupled with escalating calls to defund, monitor, or ideologically “re-balance” campuses, the controversy exposes deep political rifts over academia’s role in American life.

title: SIR in Delhi: EC prepares for revision exercise; uploads voter list of SIR-2002
content: Delhi is preparing for a special intensive revision of electoral polls. The Election Commission has uploaded the 2002 voter list and mapped it with current constituencies. This follows a meeting with state election officials to assess preparedness. A pan-India special revision is expected soon, replacing the annual summary revision.

title: What is Usain Bolt’s net worth in 2025
content: Usain Bolt's estimated net worth is $90 million in 2025. This reflects his athletic achievements and business ventures. Endorsements from Puma, Visa, and Gatorade contribute to his wealth. Bolt co-founded Bolt Mobility and expanded his restaurant chain. He faced financial challenges in 2023. Bolt enjoys family life in Kingston. His journey shows speed and resilience create lasting influence.

title: Destiny claims Elon Musk and other conservatives got him banned from Twitch
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: Stefon Diggs family tree grows: Cardi B joins legacy; roots run deep
content: Stefon Diggs family tree now includes Cardi B after the rapper revealed she is pregnant with the Patriots wide receiver’s child. From Cowboys star brother Trevon Diggs to daughter Nova and mom Stephanie, learn how the Patriots receiver’s family has shaped his life on and off the field, and what Cardi’s news means for his legacy.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan embarrassed as Andy Pycroft remains match referee for UAE clash
content: A major standoff threatened Pakistan's Asia Cup 2025 match against UAE after the ICC refused to replace match referee Andy Pycroft, despite PCB objections over his handling of the 'no-handshake' controversy with India. Initial uncertainty saw Pakistan delaying their departure for the game, and the ACC even deleted posts about the match.

title: Pakistan's late drama before UAE match: Match delayed, boycott talks - what we know
content: A cloud of uncertainty looms over the Asia Cup match between Pakistan and the UAE in Dubai, leading to a delayed start amidst reports of potential forfeit. The issue stemmed from Pakistan's objection to Andy Pycroft as match referee, despite the ICC clearing him of misconduct. While the UAE team reached the venue on time, the Pakistan team's departure was initially 'stopped'.

title: ‘Tariffs a mistake’: Bolton urges India-US talks
content: John Bolton criticized Trump's tariffs on India as a mistake that complicated negotiations and advocated for resuming talks to reduce tariffs and rebuild trust. He highlighted the importance of the Quad in countering China-Russia alignment. Bolton also noted Pakistan's statement regarding Trump's lack of involvement in de-escalating tensions after the Kashmir attack.

title: 'India's growth resilient': S&P reaffirms GDP outlook despite global turbulence
content: S&P Global India Research indicates that despite global economic challenges, India's long-term economic prospects remain robust, fueled by reforms and infrastructure development. The nation is projected to maintain a 6.5% GDP growth in fiscal 2025-26, driven by domestic strengths and increasing global trade participation. India is also poised for expansion in sectors like private credit, shipbuilding, and digital infrastructure.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
content: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: Cardi B announces pregnancy: Rapper expecting baby with NFL beau Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B announced she is pregnant with her fourth child, this time with her boyfriend, NFL star Stefon Diggs. The rapper shared her excitement about motherhood and her supportive relationship with Diggs. Her new album, 'Am I the Drama?', is out now, and she confirmed that the song 'Safe' is about her romance with Diggs, who makes her feel secure.

title: 'Welcome those who assimilate': Trump's stark message for new US citizens
content: US president Trump will now send a congratulatory letter to all new US citizens, emphasising the "sacred bond" they form with the nation's history, culture, and values. The letter, included in the citizenship packet, reminds them of their oath and the freedoms and opportunities the US offers.

title: ‘Act of terror’: Man rams car into FBI Pittsburgh office gate; manhunt on
content: Donald Henson, a former military member, is wanted after allegedly ramming a car into the FBI's Pittsburgh field office early Wednesday. Authorities are investigating the incident as a potential act of terror. Henson reportedly crashed into the gate, placed an American flag on it, and fled on foot. A message was found scrawled on the car, which is being examined.

title: Bigger, in colour: EC's new norms for EVM ballot papers; roll-out in Bihar polls
content: The Election Commission has introduced revised guidelines for the design and printing of EVM ballot papers to improve clarity for voters, particularly in the upcoming Bihar assembly election. These changes include larger color photographs of candidates, uniform font sizes for names, and the use of pink-colored 70 GSM paper for assembly elections.

title: Cardi B pregnant: Confirms baby with Stefon Diggs; fans react
content: Popular rapper Cardi B is expecting a child with Stefon Diggs. She revealed this on CBS Mornings. The baby is due in February 2026. This is her first child with Diggs. She has three children with Offset. The couple started dating in late 2024. They were seen together at a Knicks game.

title: Lodha Developers 'fraud' case: Crime branch arrests ex-director Rajendra N Lodha
content: Mumbai's crime branch has apprehended Rajendra N. Lodha, along with accomplices, for allegedly defrauding Lodha Developers of Rs 85 crore. The real estate firm accused its former director, Rajendra Narpatmal Lodha, his son, and associates of fraud, misappropriation, and criminal breach of trust. Rajendra Lodha is accused of unauthorized property sales, undervaluing land deals, and illegal TDR transactions.

title: Bahrain visa for Indians: On-arrival access, application tips, and entry rules
content: Indian citizens visiting Bahrain can obtain a visa on arrival for short stays, provided they meet basic entry requirements. Alternatively, travellers may apply online in advance by submitting necessary documents. This guide explains eligibility criteria, required paperwork, step-by-step application procedures, and arrival protocols at Bahrain International Airport, helping ensure a smooth and well-prepared travel experience.

title: 'SpaceX' cocaine: Oz pilot dies in plane crash; cops find 200kg of drugs
content: A plane crashed in Brazil, revealing a shocking discovery. Authorities found approximately 200 kg of cocaine concealed in SpaceX-labeled packaging. The Australian pilot, Timothy J. Clark, was found dead at the crash site. The plane, registered in Zambia, had extra fuel tanks. Police are investigating the drug trafficking operation and the pilot's knowledge of Brazilian air routes.

title: 'Navalny poisoned': Wife says labs reveal foul play; claims Putin responsible
content: Yulia Navalnaya, wife of Alexei Navalny, alleges that independent lab tests confirm he was poisoned while in prison. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024. The labs, located in two countries, concluded that Navalny was killed by poisoning. Navalny previously survived a poisoning attempt in 2020.

title: SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
content: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

title: Pakistan vs UAE in doubt? ACC social media post creates further chaos
content: Tensions escalate within the Pakistan camp ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against UAE, as the ACC unexpectedly deleted its social media post promoting the game, raising concerns about Pakistan's participation.

title: 'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
content: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: 'Our soldiers brought Pak to its knees': PM Modi reacts to JeM commander's video; hails Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday in Madhya Pradesh, lauded Operation Sindoor's success, citing a Jaish-e-Muhammed commander's video confession. The commander admitted the operation devastated Maulana Masood Azhar's family and JeM's Bahawalpur headquarters on May 7. Modi asserted that this "new India" fears no threats and strikes within enemy territory, prioritizing national security after Pakistani terrorists harmed Indian citizens.

title: BJ Penn Arrested: UFC icon faces charges in Hawaii
content: UFC legend BJ Penn faces renewed legal troubles after his recent arrest in Hawai'i for allegedly violating a protective order. This incident, occurring on September 15, marks another entry in a series of concerning run-ins with the law. Penn's arrest also raises questions about his well-being and how it overshadows his celebrated MMA career

title: Sebi leases Rs 7 lakh/month luxury flat for chairman - check details here
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has leased a luxurious five-bedroom apartment in Mumbai's Prabhadevi for its chairman, Tuhin Kanta Pandey, at a monthly rent of Rs 7 lakh. The three-year lease includes a 3,000 sq. ft. apartment with four car parks and a 5% annual rent escalation, aligning with Sebi's policy for leased accommodations.

title: The void between India and Pakistan is not just in skills, but also the way they train
content: Watching India and Pakistan train in Dubai highlighted the gulf between the two sides. India’s discipline, punctuality and structured sessions contrasted starkly with Pakistan’s disorganised approach. While Indian batters endured rigorous drills under coaches, Pakistan turned to casual football and trial-and-error practice — mirroring their struggles on the field.

title: 'Priyanka Chopra had bad skin, she is big-boned': Prahlad Kakkar lauds actress
content: Priyanka Chopra's journey from a pageant winner to a Bollywood star and then to Hollywood is lauded by adman Prahlad Kakkar. He reveals that she overcame disadvantages like her complexion and build with hard work and determination. Kakkar praises her ambition, focus, and dignity, especially regarding her personal life, highlighting her resilience in restarting her career in a new industry.

title: ‘Come to Vizag’: Andhra IT minister Nara Lokesh invites BlackBuck CEO Rajesh Yabaji
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh extended an invitation to BlackBuck's CEO Rajesh Yabaji to relocate the company to Visakhapatnam, following Yabaji's announcement of leaving Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road due to severe commuting issues. This move has ignited concerns within Bengaluru's IT sector regarding governance and infrastructure, prompting calls for government intervention to address deteriorating road conditions and public utilities.

title: PM Modi turns 75: Trump dials 'friend', Meloni posts selfie; wishes pour in
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with global leaders extending their heartfelt wishes, acknowledging his leadership and India's growing global influence. US President Donald Trump, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lauded PM Modi's friendship and vision. Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also conveyed their greetings, emphasising strong bilateral ties.

title: On Way To London, Trump's Air Force One Has Close Encounter With Another Plane: Report
content: A Spirit Airlines Inc. passenger jet got a little too close for comfort with a Boeing Co. 747 jumbo ferrying US President Donald Trump to London as the aircraft traveled through New York's congested skies.

title: "Deeply Appreciate Italy's Friendship": PM Thanks Giorgia Meloni For Birthday Wish
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has thanked Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni for her birthday wishes, saying he "deeply" appreciates Italy's friendship and is looking forward to "strengthening it further".

title: Chlorine Gas Leak At Water Plant In Maharashtra, 5 Employees Hospitalised
content: Five employees were affected following a leak of chlorine gas at a joint water plant of Bhiwandi, Thane and Mira Bhayandar Municipal Corporations in Bhiwandi city, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Quick Recce, Then Bang, Bang, Bang: Video Of Firing At Disha Patani's House
content: A video of last week's shooting outside actor Disha Patani's house in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly surfaced, on a day the two men involved in the incident were killed in an encounter with the police in Ghaziabad.

title: Farm Leader Says Deboarded From Train Over Protests, Court Junks Plea
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court disposed of a petition filed by farmer leader P Ayyakannu, who alleged repeated obstruction of his travel to New Delhi to participate in protests.

title: Opposition Parties To File Police Complaint Against Assam BJP Over AI Video
content: Opposition parties in Assam have said they will lodge a police complaint against the BJP over a controversial artificial intelligence-generated video circulated on social media.

title: Supreme Court Cancels Chhota Rajan's Bail In 2001 Murder Case
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday cancelled the bail of gangster Chhota Rajan, which was granted to him by the Bombay High Court in October 2024 in the 2001 murder of Jaya Shetty.

title: 2 Men Accused Of Firing At Actor Disha Patani's House Killed In Encounter
content: Two men accused of opening fire at the Bareilly residence of Bollywood actor Disha Patani were killed following a police encounter in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad today, police said.

title: Gold Worth $700,000 Stolen In Paris' Natural History Museum
content: Thieves have broken into Paris's Natural History Museum, making off with gold samples worth 600,000 euros ($700,000) in the latest of a series of robberies from cultural institutions, according to the museum.

title: During Hunger Strike In Ladakh, A Birthday Wish For PM Modi
content: It was an unusual birthday greeting for Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Ladakh. More than 500 people, currently on a hunger strike, marked his 75th birthday on Tuesday with collective prayers and wishes for his well-being.

title: Missing Schoolgirl's Mutilated Body Found In Sack In Kolkata, Teacher Arrested: Cops
content: The mutilated body of a schoolgirl, who was missing for nearly a month, was found in a sack in West Bengal's Birbhum district, a senior police officer said on Wednesday.

title: Lucknow Police Links 14-Year-Old Boy's Suicide To Gaming Addiction
content: A 14-year-old boy in Lucknow who committed suicide two days ago was addicted to mobile gaming for the last two months and had lost Rs 14 lakh from his father's bank account, police said on Wednesday.

title: Former MP, 2 Others Arrested In Rs 500-Crore Andaman & Nicobar Bank Fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested three persons, including a former Member of Parliament, in connection with a massive bank fraud case.

title: Trump's Threat After Charlie Kirk Killing Raises Fears Of Silencing Enemies
content: Trump is escalating threats to crack down on what he describes as the "radical left" following Charlie Kirk's assassination, stirring fears that his administration is trying to harness outrage over the killing to suppress political opposition

title: Hyundai Motor India, Union Sign 3-Year Wage Pact With Rs 31,000 Salary Hike
content: Hyundai Motor India Limited and the United Union of Hyundai Employees have signed a long-term wage settlement agreement covering the period from 2024 to 2027.

title: YouTube, New Leader Of US Media Industry, Bets On AI As Key For Creating Content
content: On its 20th birthday, YouTube is unrecognizable as the scrappy video site that began as the domain of young amateur users publishing unpolished, low-budget clips.

title: Cops Try To Arrest Accused In Delhi Locality, Get Thrashed By His Relatives
content: Several Delhi Police personnel were injured in an attack by a group of men while attempting to arrest a person in Delhi's Fatehpur Beri area on Tuesday.

title: 'Findings Tarnished Name, Need Fresh Probe': Air India Crash Pilot's Father
content: The father of a pilot flying the Boeing Dreamliner that crashed less than a minute after take-off from Ahmedabad, has sought a proper investigation into the tragedy.

title: After CEO's Relocation Post, Karnataka Sets November Deadline To Fix Bengaluru Potholes
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has set a deadline of November for contractors to fill potholes across Bengaluru, following mounting criticism over the city's deteriorating road conditions and civic infrastructure.

title: "Good Health, Happiness...": Shashi Tharoor Wishes PM Modi On His 75th Birthday
content: Four-time Congress MP from Thiruvananthapuram, Shashi Tharoor, on Wednesday extended birthday greetings to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Seattle, Indiana pull even, force series to Game 3
content: the WNBA playoffs are underway, but no team is going quietly . both the Seattle Storm and the Indiana Fever won to force their series to a decisive Game 3 . the longest winning streak in the series came to an end after a 14-point deficit .

title: Which players do our experts hope to draft this season?
content: we asked each of them which five players they wanted to make sure they drafted this season . the findings give an indication of who some of the most coveted fantasy players and value picks might be in your drafts . it could be a sign that the demand is high and you might need to go a round (or two) higher to land them . this season Edwards has a monster season, perhaps even MVP-caliber, to try to lead the Timberwolves to the next level .

content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the news cycle will constantly affect player values when viewed from a fantasy baseball perspective . 'make your picks Yordan Alvarez sprained his left ankle on Monday .

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: the deal includes two-night events, such as WrestleMania and SummerSlam, plus other WWE premium live events . the event will mark the first premium live event (PLE) from WWE on ESPN in September .

title: WNBA championship, series odds: Lynx, Aces current title faves
content: the Minnesota Lynx enter the WNBA playoffs as the favorite to win the fifth championship in franchise history . the team's 16-game win streak to end the regular season is the longest in four years, according to ESPN Research . star A'ja Wilson wrapped up her second consecutive scoring title, after the Storm won Tuesday night .

title: What we're watching for all 32 NHL teams as the preseason begins
content: the 2025 NHL draft was decentralized, but there was no shortage of memorable moments and celebrity cameos . a chill enters the air, the leaves start to change color and pumpkin-themed items appear on food and drink menu . how to watch the NHL season on ESPN networks -- including 100 exclusive games .

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: 'If some people are behind bars ... ': SC seeks tough action on pollution
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Palaniswami has pledged AIADMK with the BJP, says Stalin
content: Mr. Palaniswami wants to safeguard himself from raids by Central agencies. He did nothing for the State when he was in power, and did not have the courage to raise his voice against the Centre to safeguard the interests of the State, says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

title: Delhi court declines urgent hearing on Adani gag order, journalists decry takedown notices
content: In their appeals in the case, journalists have contended that the court passed an over-broad and all-encompassing restraining order without identifying which specific content was defamatory

title: Arguments on Gulmarg lease, PIL on environmental issues to be heard on next date of hearing: J&K High Court
content: In August, the High Court sought a final stand of government, following two separate opinions submitted by Raj Bhawan and Chief Minister’s Office in sealed covers

title: ORR infra woes: Industry veterans rally around tech firm
content: Prominent Bengalureans urge the State government to immediately intervene after trucking platform BlackBuck decided to move out of Bellandur on Outer Ring Road, citing traffic and commuting woes

title: Cabinet approves exclusive Ministry for Kalyana Karnataka region development
content: Sharanabasappa Darshanapur addresses gathering after unfurling National Flag to mark Kalyana Karnataka Utsav celebrations in Yadgir

title: Rains damage connecting roads to Mussorrie, hotels offer free stay to hundreds of stranded tourists
content: Hotel owners says over 3,000 travellers are stranded, unable to find their way to Dehradun; bid to fly patients from the ITBP helipad in Mussoorie fails; police ask people not to take out vehicles

title: Education Ministry tells CBSE, Central schools to screen film based on PM Modi’s childhood
content: Schools directed to screen Chalo Jeete Hain between September 16 and October 2; film will serve as case study on moral reasoning, help students reflect on character, service, responsibility, says Ministry

title: DPS Nacharam student injured after ‘birthday bumps’
content: The 14-year-old undergoes surgery after testicular damage; doctors advise three months of complete bed rest after which full recovery will be assessed; school staff, classmates booked

title: Hunger strike for Ladakh’s Statehood enters seventh day; will remain ‘apolitical’, say protesters
content: The Leh Apex Body said that it has decided to keep the movement “apolitical” and members of the Congress party associated with the movement have been asked to step down

title: Former Hurriyat chairman Abdul Gani Bhat, who held talks with NDA leaders two decades ago, passes away
content: Bhat, 89, was a staunch advocate of talks with both Indian and Pakistani governments; met BJP leader and then-Deputy PM L.K. Advani in 2004; slammed by Hurriyat for willingness to talk to New Delhi

title: Disha Patani Bareilly home firing: Two shooters killed in encounter
content: The encounter was carried out in a joint operation by Delhi Police Special Cell, Uttar Pradesh STF and Haryana STF, officials said

title: ED takes ex-MUDA Commissioner Dinesh Kumar into custody
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has taken former Commissioner of Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA) G.T. Dinesh Kumar into custody

title: EU announces upgrade to partnership with India but warns of risks from India-Russia trade
content: EU’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas terms India a crucial partner and releases strategic agenda on trade, technology, security, defence and climate

title: EVMs to display colour photographs of candidates beginning with Bihar polls
content: ECI has revised norms for EVM ballot papers; serial numbers of candidates will now be displayed more prominently, their faces will occupy three-fourths of photo space

title: As Project Cheetah turns three, female cheetah relocated from Kuno to Gandhisagar
content: Gandhisagar now has three cheetahs, including two males who were moved there from Kuno in April this year

title: CPI(M) MP John Brittas raises concern over outsourcing operational backend work of parliamentary e-mail system to a private firm
content: The Rajya Sabha member argues that this move can compromise the confidentiality of communications sent by parliamentarians through their official email accounts

title: Tucker Kraft, Brian Branch lead Team of the Week 2
content: totw 2's limited editions (LTDs) sporting 89 OVR are Green Bay Packers TE Tucker Kraft and Detroit Lions safety Brian Branch . Kraft earned his LTD with six receptions, 124 receiving yards and one touchdown .

title: Catholic Church opposes BJP plan to celebrate PM Modi’s birthday inside church
content: Father Sebastian Arolichalil denounces poster circulating on social media. Says neither the church or the diocese has anything to do with it. He denies hosting any such function and condemns the poster featuring Muthalakkodom church.

title: Two construction workers killed as compound wall falls on them in Idukki
content: Munnar tahsildar says Revenue department in January had issued a stop memo for the construction work on the resort

title: Interim flood relief of ₹1,600 crore is ‘grave injustice’ to Punjab, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Opposition leader says State has suffered a loss of at least ₹20,000 crore, lakhs of people lost their houses and over four lakh acres of paddy crop got destroyed in the floods

title: Continuous reforms a must in armed forces, says CDS
content: Gen. Chauhan says it will ensure preparedness in an increasingly complex global security environment; reiterates armed forces’ commitment to remain self-reliant and future-ready

title: Mention Lingayat in religion column during survey, says mahasabha
content: The Dharwad unit of the Jagatika Lingayat Mahasabha has made an appeal to the followers of Basavanna

title: Naidu to finalise Godavari Pushkarams-2027 budget in October
content: ₹456 crore drainage, roads and pushkar ghats development underway, additionally ₹290 crore AMRUT 2.0 works tender to be invited, says Minister Narayana

title: Kalyana Karnataka is now seeing a significant increase in development initiatives: Khandre
content: The Minister was addressing a gathering after unfurling the National Flag to mark Kalyana Karnataka Utsav celebrations in Bidar

title: New India led by Modi is inspiring the world: U.P. CM Yogi
content: Seva Pakhwada will be observed from September 17 to October 2, featuring a series of creative and socially unifying activities to mark Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 75th birthday

title: Watch: Tejashwi Yadav launches Bihar Adhikar Yatra against Nitish Kumar government
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav kicked off his Bihar Adhikar Yatra on September 16, calling it a fight against unemployment, inflation, and atrocities against women.

title: Watch: Why India could lose billions in US trade
content: India’s exports to the United States dropped sharply in August, with shipments falling to $6.7 billion. Experts warn prolonged duties could cost India $30–35 billion in exports and impact jobs if not addressed promptly.

title: Despite late OTPs, payment failures, online RTI queries may cross 1 million this year
content: Already, 7,66,167 requests have been filed so far in 2025. These numbers do not represent all RTI applications sent to the Central government, as many are filed physically

title: Karnataka govt. has approved funds for night-landing facility at Shivamogga Airport, says Madhu Bangarappa
content: Lok Sabha member B.Y. Raghavendra and district in charge minister Madhu Bangarapa recently engaged in a public spat over the absence of night-landing facility at the airport

title: Lack of effective control on maintenance activities led to Air India flight’s emergency landing in 2024, finds probe
content: Investigation report states that the DGCA headquarters may take appropriate action against Air India for failing to ensure the satisfactory completion of scheduled tasks and for not monitoring the oil uplift/oil consumption data of the Auxiliary Power Unit

title: Turning Sabarimala into global pilgrimage centre among aims of Ayyappa sangamam: Vasavan
content: TDB plans to explore investment opportunities for improving basic infrastructure at pilgrimage centre

title: Thieves try their luck with Thiruvonam Bumper lottery tickets in Kozhikode district
content: A lottery agent from Koyilandy claimed that he lost 52 Thiruvonam Bumper tickets in a theft which reportedly took place last Sunday

title: SBI yet to release Kingfisher asset sale money, staff await dues
content: A total of 2,200 Kingfisher employees have filed claims with the liquidator’s office for a total sum of ₹3,000 crore; total dues owed by Kingfisher to various creditors not yet determined

title: People’s cooperation vital to make Andhra Pradesh dump yard-free, says MA&UD Minister Narayana
content: Government working towards making roads clean, providing safe drinking water, and putting in place a good solid and liquid waste management system in urban areas, he says

title: Archbishop Emeritus Mar Jacob Thoomkuzhy passes away at 94
content: His life spanned decades of tireless pastoral service, institution building, and social empowerment — especially among the struggling migrant Christian communities in Malabar. He was the first bishop of the Mananthavady diocese and later served as the archbishop of Thrissur

title: Gehlot accuses BJP of pressuring probe agencies in Rajasthan closure reports
content: Former CM cites Sanjivani scam, 2020 government-toppling case; alleges BJP shielding Shekhawat, manipulating investigations

title: Former Chief Minsiter A.K. Antony regrets the “legally unavoidable” 1995 Sivagiri police action
content: Says he had planned to elucidate on Sivagiri, Muthanga and also the Marad communal riots after the 2026 byelections to avoid ruffling feathers. However, the unilateral and undefended attacks against him in the House prompts the public response.

title: Caste system root of inequality, says Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Education is the only tool to fight inequality and claim your rightful place in society, he says while urging oppressed communities to embrace it

title: CAT reserves order on DGP Yogesh Gupta’s plea
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!
